work.name: AI Driven Operation / NTSprint
work.summary: I designed de system and implemented a full-stack AI-powered letter generation system for an insurance company, handling the entire architecture and development independently. The solution included a Vite + React + TypeScript frontend deployed on Vercel and a modular Node.js + Express backend hosted on Render. The system integrated PostgreSQL (Supabase) for the database and Auth0 for authentication, while custom OpenAI assistants were embedded in the backend. All sensitive data was encrypted to ensure compliance with security regulations and legal requirements.
highlights: Vite, React, Tailwind CSS, TypeScript, Node.js, Express, JavaScript, PostgreSQL, Supabase, Auth0, OpenAI API, Custom AI Asistants, Data Encryption, Vercel, Render, Cloud Integration

work.name: QSpace / NTSprint
work.summary: I developed and maintained the project's API using AWS Lambda to build a microservices architecture with Node.js and Express. I expanded functionality across multiple APIs and enabled seamless integrations between modules using RESTful principles. Additionally, I implemented AWS services for centralized logging and error filtering, ensuring critical issues were automatically emailed to clients. I integrated email notification systems and optimized performance by refactoring inefficient code. I also enforced JSDoc standards to document all microservices, improving code maintainability and team collaboration.
highlights: AWS, JavaScript, Node.js, Express, Microservices, JSDoc.c

work.name: Explora/ NTSprint
work.summary: I develop and maintain two Angular frontends (admin and user-facing) with Tailwind CSS, integrating a Lumen-based BFF and Squidex CMS for dynamic content. Keycloak handles authentication, while my role involves feature enhancements, bug fixes, and UI/UX improvements. I also refactor code for better maintainability and optimize performance through image handling and search/sort algorithms. I boosted SEO by adding alt text, meta keywords, and semantic HTML, improving search visibility. Team turnover caused inconsistent code quality, which we mitigated with style guides, linters, and daily standups. These measures ensured consistency and streamlined issue resolution despite frequent personnel changes. A key challenge was Squidex’s lack of reference data sorting, requiring custom solutions to meet project needs. My contributions—from performance tuning to overcoming CMS limitations—strengthened the application’s scalability, usability, and long-term maintainability.
highlights: Angular, TailwindCSS, Google Analytics, SEO, Vercel, Lumen, Squidex, Keycloak.

work.name: Wassermeloni/ Aleph Engineer
work.summary: I modernized a legacy Angular/Rails app by upgrading Angular, fixing dependencies, and refactoring code while resolving 800 broken tests using TDD. Implemented a CI/CD pipeline, cutting deployment costs by 50% and improving security through dependency updates. The overhaul reduced technical debt, enhanced maintainability, and streamlined development with better versioning and testing.
highlights: Laravel, PHP, Vue, Bootstrap, Auth0, MySQL.

work.name: Imagined Earth/ Aleph Engineer
work.summary: I led the rebuild of an Ionic/Angular mobile app, fix memory leaks, slow authentication (7min → 3s), and inefficient APIs. Added features like Google Maps (cut costs 90%), in-app sales, and a UI redesign while optimizing Laravel backend performance. Deployed updates to Google Play/App Store and integrated push notifications, reducing errors and downtime. These improvements boosted retention and slashed server costs.
highlights: Angular, Ionic, Laravel, Google Analytics, Google Maps, Web Sockets, Google Play, Apps Store.
